intro: Capsella sinuatolinearis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sowthistle, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into spherical, hairy seed pods. Capsella sinuatolinearis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
